column1: Alquízar (Spanish pronunciation: [alˈkisaɾ]) is a town and municipality in the Artemisa Province of Cuba.
The settlement was first mentioned in 1616
column2: as a coffee plantation owned by Don Sancho de Alquízar
column3: who gives the name of the community. In 1826

column1: The town is located in the south-west corner of the province
column2: south-west of San Antonio de los Baños and west of Güira de Melena.

column1: The municipality is divided into the barrios of Guanímar

column2: the municipality of Alquízar had a population of 29
column3: 616. With a total area of 193 km2 (75 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 153.5/km2 (398/sq mi).
